instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> clean dumps required
threads.message: I have 2 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 1 with board number <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a and 1 with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-04 Im looking for clean bios for both but have no luck with search function on the forum.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> clean dumps required
threads.message:
What exact problems do you have?
Usually need to clean ME of backup BIOS.
Upload them somewhere, if you don't have Medusa programmer...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> clean dumps required
threads.message:
Here is the clean ME BIOS for first board.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gNNXNFkPmmqJr4NOhqkemOSs3wYoXOAH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

The second one should have another problem, if no internal image.
To discard BIOS problem, just try above file.
It should work, good for test; maybe machine will be slowly.

threads.message: Thank you. I will try that out.
